result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Meghan A McWilliams was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail on deposit to be applied to fine/cost/surcharge.  Remaining balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha Police Department.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Compliance with OWI Treatment Court.  Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
First 45 days with Huber, release for work and childcare.  Remaining 210 days Stayed, to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  Court grants 4 days credit.  Court has no objection to Electronic Monitoring if the Sheriff deems appropriate.
7/22/22 SENTENCE COMMENCING FORTHWITH
